      • randHexData

        public static java.lang.String randHexData(int characters)
        Parameters:
        characters - the number of characters to return
        Returns:
        a hex string full of entropy

      • randHexLong

        public static java.lang.String randHexLong()
        Note: no gaurantees are given for the return value's length
        Returns:
        a hex-encoded number between 0 and 2^63-1

      • hash

        public static java.lang.String hash(java.lang.String s)
        Currently uses MD5 because it is fast and lightweight. This also makes it rather insecure. If security ever becomes a priority, this may be changed to SHA-1 or SHA-256.
        Parameters:
        s - String to be hashed
        Returns:
        The hash of the string

      • sleep

        public static int sleep(int ms)
        Abstract out catching interrupted exceptions
        Parameters:
        ms - the number of milliseconds to sleep for
        Returns:
        the number of milliseconds we actually slept for

                                       boolean stopOnTwoLineBreaks)
        Parameters:
        in - source to read from
        stopOnTwoLineBreaks - Stop reading the stream when two linebreaks are ecountered. This is mostly for HTTP requests.
